title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency programs. Grants will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations for research and awareness education on emergency preparedness in urban and rural areas affected by disasters. The program aims to develop and promote emergency preparedness education in disadvantaged communities through culturally competent materials. Eligible organizations must be nonprofit with a primary mission to serve disadvantaged communities and demonstrate a partnership with a disadvantaged business enterprise. Enterprises in HUBZones can use funds from grants, contracts, or agreements to acquire professional services for research in disadvantaged communities, create informational materials for emergency preparedness awareness, and collaborate with national organizations to disseminate emergency information. The organization must submit an application to the Director to be eligible for a grant, contract, or cooperative agreement under this section. The Director will establish a review procedure for the applications. The Director will establish a procedure to accept applications for grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements. Definitions for disadvantaged business enterprise, disadvantaged community, disadvantaged individual, and HUBZone are provided in this section. Authorization of Appropriation is granted for fiscal years 2004 through 2007 to carry out the provisions of the Small Business Act.
